body_content.explanation: a problem affecting one or both of the joints between the temporal bones (= the bones at the sides of the head at the base of the skull) and the mandible (= the lower jaw):
examples: The dentist diagnosed temporomandibular joint disorder, a condition where the hinge connecting the upper and lower jaw doesn't work correctly.
Temporomandibular joint dysfunction causes pain and tenderness in your jaw joints and surrounding muscles and ligaments.
